Events and trends
* Battle of Megiddo (15th century BC) between Thutmose III and a coalition under
  the King of Kadesh. It is the first battle to have been recorded in what is
  accepted as relatively reliable detail. The battle took place in year 23 I
  Shemsu day 20 (or possibly day 21). The exact year depends on the year
  Thutmose ascended to the throne of Egypt and among scholars the estimates
  range from 1479 to 1504 BC. Using the 1479 BC estimate the battle could have
  taken place in May 1457 BC. O'Connor, David and Cline, Eric H. Thutmose
  III: A New Biography University of Michigan Press. 2006 ISBN 978-0-472-11467-2
  pages 416-420.
